description.narrative: (i) Access to finance for SMEs: The Fund is expected to provide much needed mezzanine and equity financing to 12-15 SMEs in Central America and neighboring countries to support their growth and expansion. The lack of private capital continues to be a primary inhibitor to SME growth in developing economies, and in particular IDA countries. IFC's commitment to the Fund will help develop the private equity asset class. (ii) Job creation: The Fund is expected to generate strong job creation, and in particular in low-income, IDA, and/or violence-affected communities. (iii) Private sector development: The Fund will strengthen investees from a financial, operational, management, and ESG standpoint, and will thereby promote sustainable growth of SMEs, create strong leadership, instill good practice business models, and promote transparency. (iv) Poverty alleviation: Central America faces staggeringly high poverty rates, particularly in the two IDA countries of Nicaragua, with a poverty rate of 46%, and Honduras, with a poverty rate of 60%. IFC's commitment will help LIM continue its mission of reducing poverty through private sector growth.

The project entails a US$10 million equity commitment, not to exceed 20% of total commitments, in CASEIF III L.P. (the Fund), a ten-year closed-end private equity fund seeking to raise US$50 million to make mezzanine and equity investments in 12-15 small and medium enterprises (SMEs) in Central America, the Dominican Republic, and Colombia.

participating-org.narrative: CASEIF III LIMITED PARTNERSHIP (CASEIF III LP)

mailing-address.narrative: Erick Lagos Managing Director Lafise Investment Management Ltd. Centro Financiero LAFISE Km 5 ½ Carretera a Masaya Managua, Nicaragua T: (505) 2277-1111 E: mailto:erlagos@lafise.com

name.narrative: CASEIF III L.P. will be structured as a Canadian limited partnership. Lafise Investment Management Ltd., the fund management company, will be a Bahamas company. LIM, Ltd., the general partner, will be a Cayman Islands exempted company. The Fund will make investments in the Latin America and the Caribbean (LAC) region, primarily in Central America, the Dominican Republic, and Colombia. The fund management company will primarily operate out of Managua, Nicaragua and San Jose, Costa Rica.

activity-description.narrative: A description that qualifies the activity taking place at the location.

receiver-org.narrative: CASEIF III LIMITED PARTNERSHIP (CASEIF III LP)
